annotation.remark: Copyright details are filled in by the template.

abstract.para: This document is intended for software developers who are interested in developing applications using the Rackspace Cloud Queues Application Programming Interface (API).

revdescription.para: Moved the operation errors from the "Faults" section of the Cloud Queues Developer Guide to the appropriate operation description in the "API operations" chapter in the guide.
Updated Cloud Queues to begin billing for the service. The "Pricing and service level" section in both the Cloud Queues Getting Started Guide and the Cloud Queues Developer Guide has been updated.
Updated the "Pricing and service level" section in the API documentation to reflect the new time frame to begin billing for Cloud Queues.

listitem.para: The maximum size of posted messages is now the maximum size of the entire request document, including whitespace, rather than the sum of the individual message "body" parameter values. On error, the client is now notified of how much the request exceeded the limit.
The maximum size of metadata is now the maximum size of the document, including whitespace.

revdescription.para: Updated the claim messages description in the Cloud Queues Getting Started Guide to show the correct status code (201 Created) in the response example.

Updated the post message description in the "API operations" section of the Cloud Queues Developer Guide to include the information that you must include even a single message in a JSON array or you will receive the error message Invalid request body.

listitem.para: Removed the claim_id parameter from the URI for the operation that gets messages by ID in the Cloud Queues Developer Guide.

Updated the instructions for locating the API key, tenant ID, and account number in the Cloud Control Panel in the "Retrieving the authentication token" section in the Cloud Queues Getting Started Guide and in the Cloud Queues Developer Guide.

preface.title: Preface
preface.para: This document describes new features and changes for the Cloud Queues API.
For detailed information about the Cloud Queues API, see the following documentation at http://docs.rackspace.com/:
Support for Cloud Queues is available 24x7x365 via phone or chat, or you can also file a ticket.
You can also provide feedback by using the Product Feedback forum.
Rackspace welcomes your comments, feedback, and bug reports .

chapter.title: Document change history
chapter.para: This version of the release notes replaces and obsoletes all earlier versions. The most recent changes are described in the following table:

chapter.title: April 16, 2014
chapter.para: This release includes a documentation change that moved the operation errors from the "Faults" section of the Cloud Queues Developer Guide to the appropriate operation description in the "API operations" chapter in the guide.

chapter.title: March 4, 2014
chapter.para: This release updates Cloud Queues to begin billing for the service. As part of the Rackspace Cloud, your use of the Cloud Queues API will be billed according to the pricing schedule at http://www.rackspace.com/cloud/queues.
The Service Level Agreement (SLA) for Cloud Queues is available at http://www.rackspace.com/information/legal/cloud/sla.

The "Pricing and service level" section in both the Cloud Queues Getting Started Guide and the Cloud Queues Developer Guide has been updated to include links to the pricing and service level information.

chapter.title: January 28, 2014
chapter.para: This release includes a change in the time frame for billing to begin for Cloud Queues. The "Pricing and service level" section in the Cloud Queues Getting Started Guide and in the Cloud Queues Developer Guide has been changed to indicate that Cloud Queues is free through February 2014. Customers are not eligible for Cloud Queues SLA credits until billing begins.
Moved the operation errors from the "Faults" section of the Cloud Queues Developer Guide to the appropriate operation description in "API operations" chapter in the guide.

chapter.title: January 22, 2014
chapter.para: This release is includes the following changes for the Cloud Queues API.

listitem.para: The maximum size of posted messages is now the maximum size of the entire request document, including whitespace, rather than the sum of the individual message "body" parameter values. On error, the client is now notified of by how much the request exceeded the limit.
The maximum size of metadata is now the maximum size of the document, including whitespace.
The documentation was updated to include the following new information based on the preceding code change:
In the Cloud Queues Getting Started Guide, the maximum size information was updated in the "Post message" section.

In the Cloud Queues Developer Guide, the maximum size information for the data limits in the "Absolute limits" section was updated, as were the set queue metadata and post message operations descriptions in the "API operations" section.

chapter.title: January 14, 2014
chapter.para: This release includes the following documentation change for the Cloud Queues API:

listitem.para: In the Cloud Queues Getting Started Guide, the "Claim messages" section was updated to correct the status code shown in the response example to 201 (Created).

chapter.title: December 19, 2013
chapter.para: This release includes the following documentation change for the Cloud Queues API:

listitem.para: In the Cloud Queues Developer Guide, the post message description in the "API operations" section was updated to specify that you must include even a single message in a JSON array or you will receive the error message Invalid request body.

chapter.title: December 12, 2013
chapter.para: This release includes the following documentation changes for the Cloud Queues API:

listitem.para: In the Cloud Queues Developer Guide, the claim_id parameter was removed from the URI for the get messages by ID operation description.

In the Cloud Queues Getting Started Guide and in the Cloud Queues Developer Guide, the instructions for locating the API key, tenant ID, and account number in the Cloud Control Panel were updated in "Retrieving the authentication token" section.

chapter.title: November 04, 2013
chapter.para: This release is the initial Unlimited Availability (UA) release of the Cloud Queues API.

chapter.title: October 09, 2013
chapter.para: This release is the initial Limited Access (LA) release of the Cloud Queues API.
